page.title: 05EDUCATION AT ROLPH SCHOOL
page.content: { Rolph School}is a Church of England Primary School catering for children between the ages of 5 and 11. It has strong connections with the Parish Church. It was founded by James Rolph, a local farmer, whose birthday is remembered on June 9th each year. The school is very active and its curriculum includes lacemaking, machine embroidery, cooking and country dancing in addition to the usual activities. The school is well equipped with a BBC computer, disc drive and monitor, a colour television and a video recorder. It also has 12 violins. At present there are 150 pupils in 5 classes but numbers are rising and in September this year the headmistress, Mrs. Sylvia Alcock, will no longer be a teaching head. The school has a large playground and a playing field with a football pitch.
